content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
1. Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
   Purpose: Automates smelting processes by linking key processing units.  
   Consists of:  
   • Stone furnaces at positions (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0)  
   • Burner‑inserters deployed at locations including (–14.5, –52.5), (–13.5, –52.5), (–16.5, –48.5), (–11.5, –48.5), etc.  
   • Wooden chests at positions such as (–13.5, –51.5), (–11.5, –46.5), (1.5, 1.5), (2.5, 0.5) and (0.5, 2.5)  
   • BeltGroups interlinking these components for material routing  

2. Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
   Purpose: Automates the extraction and initial handling of iron ore.  
   Consists of:  
   • A burner‑mining drill at (–15.0, –50.0)  
   • Associated burner‑inserters, transport belts, and chests that form the resource extraction and redistribution network  

3. Steam Power Generation System  
   Purpose: Provides power by converting fuel and water into steam energy.  
   Consists of:  
   • A boiler at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
   • Steam engines positioned at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5)  
   • An extra steam engine remains unplaced in inventory due to persistent spatial congestion  

4. Automation Research Lab  
   Purpose: Supports technological research using automation science packs.  
   Consists of:  
   • Laboratory units (e.g., with electrical IDs 11057, 11109, 11135) that are currently experiencing power connectivity (NO_POWER) issues  

5. Electrical, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
   Purpose: Establishes an integrated backbone for power distribution, material logistics, and fluid handling.  
   Consists of:  
   • ElectricityGroups (with various IDs such as 11135)  
   • Several BeltGroups that interconnect production zones  
   • Multiple PipeGroups forming interconnected fluid systems across the map  

6. Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
   Purpose: Delivers a reliable water supply to fluid‐dependent processes.  
   Consists of:  
   • An offshore pump at (0.5, 30.5)  
   • Associated PipeGroups routing water throughout the network

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  - The extra steam engine remains unplaced owing to severe spatial congestion within the boiler zone, particularly around Position(8.0, 20.5) and its adjacent connection interfaces.  
  - Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts prevent the creation of a clear area for engine placement.  
  - Mitigation: Manually reassess and clear the boiler zone and adjoining interfaces; remove or reposition conflicting entities and consider relocating the extra steam engine or redesigning the boiler layout to provide sufficient buildable space.

• Fuel and Source Supply Warnings in Burner Entities  
  - Multiple burner‑inserters and mining drills are flagged with “NO_FUEL” and “WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS” warnings, indicating inconsistent fuel or resource delivery.  
  - Mitigation: Verify fuel inventories and adjust logistics to ensure timely refueling and source item delivery to burner devices.

• Power Network Connectivity Issues  
  - Several steam engines and lab units report being “not connected to power network” or are flagged with NO_POWER status.  
  - Mitigation: Reevaluate and reinforce electrical connections by repositioning power poles and reconfiguring wiring to integrate critical structures reliably into the power network.
